intro: Dieudonnaea, commonly known as the "spear-leaved dandelion," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, spear-shaped leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant is native to southern Africa and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Dieudonnaea species are often found in rocky or sandy soils, demonstrating adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers produce small, wind-dispersed seeds, aiding in its propagation across dry landscapes.
